item.title: ‘I have never been asked for money before’: My friend wants to borrow $1,600 to pay her rent. Do I say yes?
item.description: “I have heard mixed reviews on lending people money.”

item.title: ‘The sky has not fallen — yet’: Is it time to start worrying about a U.S. recession?
item.description: GDP rose by 3% in the second quarter, but the economy added just 73,000 new jobs in July.

item.title: ‘I worked at 14, had an 8.8% mortgage rate and drove used cars’: Did boomers really have it easier than millennials?
item.description: ‘We were frugal, using coupons, discount stores, shopping during the sales and eating leftovers,’ one baby-boomer reader writes.

item.title: Will my spouse automatically inherit my 401(k)?
item.description: “What happens if the participant gets married again, but doesn’t update the beneficiary to be their new spouse? “

item.title: The ‘great wealth transfer’ is coming. Many people will be rich — but they’re not ready.
item.description: Inheriting money is one thing; keeping it is another.
